TITLE: Goclone Command Line Options
DESCRIPTION: The complete usage guide for Goclone, showing all available command-line flags and options. Includes options for setting cookies, custom user agent, proxy connections, and serving cloned content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
Usage:
  goclone <url> [flags]

Flags:
  -C, --cookie strings        Pre-set these cookies
  -h, --help                  help for goclone
  -o, --open                  Automatically open project in default browser
  -p, --proxy_string string   Proxy connection string. Support http and socks5 https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/gocolly/colly#Collector.SetProxy
  -s, --serve                 Serve the generated files using Echo.
  -P, --servePort int         Serve port number. (default 5000)
  -u, --user_agent string     Custom User Agent
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Goclone Usage Example
DESCRIPTION: A simple example showing how to use Goclone to download and clone a website. The command takes a URL as its main argument.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# goclone <url>
goclone https://configtree.co
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manual Installation of Goclone from Source
DESCRIPTION: Step-by-step instructions for installing Goclone by cloning the repository and building it from source code. Includes an optional step to make the binary globally available.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone.git
cd goclone
# Build and run
go build -o goclone cmd/goclone/main.go
# Move binary to a directory in your PATH (optional)
mv goclone /usr/local/bin/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Goclone with Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for installing the Goclone utility using the Homebrew package manager. This involves tapping the repository and then installing the tool.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# tap
brew tap goclone-dev/goclone
# install tool
brew install goclone
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Goclone via Go Install
DESCRIPTION: Command to install Goclone directly using Go's module system. Requires Go version 1.20 or higher to work properly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-19_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Go version >= 1.20
go install github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/cmd/goclone@latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pulling Down a Branch in Git
DESCRIPTION: Command for pulling down the newly created branch in your local development environment after creating it on GitHub.
SOURCE: https://github.com/goclone-dev/goclone/blob/master/docs/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-19_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git pull
```
